page.title: 09Geography and Ecology
page.content:
Our area is in the middle of a boulder clay vale. It is, therefore, very flat and low lying - nowhere does it rise about 15 feet above sea level. Drainage within the area is therefore extremely important.
The nature of the land and its topography make it an ideal area for growing cereal crops along with root crops. Oil seed rape, barley and wheat, along with potatoes make up the vast majority of the cultivated acreage. All the land within our area is classified as grade II land.
Hedgrows have tended to disappear as prairie farming has taken over.
